meanings.definition: A short, simple tune or melody.
meanings.sent1: She hummed a little ditt as she walked to the park.
meanings.sent2: The radio played a catchy ditt that got stuck in my head.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp a cheerful ditt to wake everyone up.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like a joyful ditt that echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried the sweet ditt of a distant flute player.

meanings.definition: To repeat or recite something, especially a poem or verse.
meanings.sent1: He would often ditt his favorite poem to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to ditt the lines of the play for practice.
meanings.sent3: She would jokingly ditt the same excuse whenever she was late.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor would ditt the headlines with a serious tone.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to ditt their favorite nursery rhymes together.

meanings.definition: A small, insignificant amount or portion.
meanings.sent1: He only had a ditt of sugar left for his coffee.
meanings.sent2: She added a ditt of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant carried a ditt of food back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: The old man gave him a ditt of advice before he left.
meanings.sent5: The artist added a ditt of blue to the painting for contrast.
